snippet: As its oil inventory grows because of tough sanctions, Iran has taken to repainting and renaming its tankers, concealing their origins in a bid to find buyers.
abstract: Iran, as its oil inventory grows because of the embargo, has taken to repainting and renaming its tankers, concealing their origins in a bid to find buyers; oil analysts say Iranian exports have been cut by at least 25 percent since the start of 2012, costing the country about $10 billion so far in forgone revenues.

byline.original: By THOMAS ERDBRINK and CLIFFORD KRAUSS
byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink reported from Bandar Abbas, and Clifford Krauss from Houston.

lead_paragraph: As its oil inventory grows because of tough sanctions, Iran has taken to repainting and renaming its tankers, concealing their origins in a bid to find buyers.

headline.seo: Oil Embargo Leads Iran to Disguise Tankers
headline.main: Oil Backed Up, Iranians Put It on Idled Ships
headline.print_headline: Oil Backed Up, Iranians Put It On Idled Ships

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
